title: Magnus Aarbakke
text:
Magnus Aarbakke (born 14 October 1934 in <a href="Tysnes">Tysnes</a>, <a href="Hordaland">Hordaland</a>) is a <a href="Norwegians">Norwegian</a> judge.
He was born in <a href="Tysnes">Tysnes</a>. He took the <a href="Juris%20Doctor">Dr.juris</a> degree in 1967 for the thesis "Virksomhetsbegrepet i norsk skatterett", and was a professor at the <a href="University%20of%20Oslo">University of Oslo</a> from 1968 to 1990. He specialized in <a href="commercial%20law">commercial law</a>, and was among the editors of the journal "Tidsskrift for rettsvitenskap" between 1974 and 2001. After leaving the professorship he worked as a lawyer for some years, and then served as a <a href="Supreme%20Court%20of%20Norway">Supreme Court Justice</a> from 1994 to 2002. He is a member of the <a href="Norwegian%20Academy%20of%20Science%20and%20Letters">Norwegian Academy of Science and Letters</a>. On May 31, 1996 Aarbakke received an <a href="Honorary%20degree">honorary doctorate</a> from the Faculty of Law at <a href="Uppsala%20University">Uppsala University</a>, <a href="Sweden">Sweden</a>
